Next to the slasher films of the 1970s and 80s, ones about the walking dead were probably the second most popular horror sub-genre in modern times. The success of George A. Romero’s first zombie film, Night of the Living Dead, and his subsequent entries in the series drove the sub-genre into popular culture, spawning plenty of unofficial films, even before Hollywood took notice. The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, the crew are found in an area swarming with feeding Tyrannosaursu and biting Tasmanian Tigers. They group tries to make their way back to safety only to run into kidnappers looking to sell the survivors on the black market.
